abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the First Phase of National Capital Power
            Supply Project for the National Thermal Power Corporation
            (NTPC) and the Delhi Electric Supply Undertaking (DESU) in
            India. The objectives of the project were to: (a) augment
            power supplies to the capital; (b) improve the reliability
            of transmission and reduce system losses; (c) reduce
            environmental pollution from power generation; (d) move
            towards more efficient use of existing assets in the power
            supply system; (e) identify economic opportunities for
            improving the quality of coal use in power generation; and,
            (f) effect a program of administrative, financial and
            operational improvements in DESU. Bank’s performance was
            satisfactory. Borrower’s performance was satisfactory. The
            key lessons learned were as follows: (i) a sound financial
            health is a key element to the success of a utility; (b) the
            need for energy conservation on the customer State
            Electricity Board (SEB) side and demand management by the
            utility through the adoption of appropriate tariffs and
            tariff structure at SEBs and through end-use efficiencies;
            e) project preparation, with all its components, should be
            completed in detail well ahead of loan negotiations; and (f)
            failure by reputed local manufacturers to deliver critical
            equipment on time has caused the project long delays.
